hero.title: Cultivating Connections, Harvesting Prosperity
hero.subtitle: We are on a mission to digitize and connect the global agricultural supply chain, empowering every stakeholder from the soil to the shelf.

vision.title: Our Vision for a Connected Future
vision.p1: DamDoh was born from a simple yet powerful idea: that technology can bridge the gaps in the agricultural world. We envision a world where smallholder farmers have direct access to global markets, where buyers can source produce with verifiable trust, and where knowledge flows freely to create a more sustainable and equitable food system.
vision.p2: We are more than just a platform; we are a community dedicated to solving real-world challenges with innovative, user-centric solutions.

challenge.title: The Fragmented Landscape of Agriculture
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is complex and often disconnected, presenting numerous challenges for everyone involved.

list.knowledge: Information Gaps: Farmers lack access to modern techniques and real-time market data.
list.market: Market Access: Smallholders struggle to connect with larger, more profitable markets.
list.quality: Quality & Trust: Buyers face uncertainty about produce quality, origin, and farming practices.
list.logistics: Inefficient Logistics: Poor coordination leads to high costs and significant post-harvest losses.
list.financial: Financial Exclusion: Lack of formal records prevents access to credit and insurance.
list.climate: Climate Change: Increasing unpredictability requires more resilient farming systems.
list.informal: Informal Economy: A lack of digital records hinders growth and formalization.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution: An Integrated Ecosystem
solution.description: We tackle these challenges by providing a single, unified platform with tools for everyone.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: Farmers connecting with other farmers to share knowledge and form cooperatives.

p2b.title: Producer-to-Business
p2b.content: Direct links between farmers and buyers, processors, and exporters, cutting out unnecessary middlemen.

p2e.title: Producer-to-Expert
p2e.content: Access to agronomists, financial advisors, and logistics providers to improve operations.

p2w.title: Producer-to-World
p2w.content: Enabling smallholder farmers to participate in the global marketplace with trust and transparency.

commitment.title: Join Our Growing Ecosystem
commitment.p1: Our commitment is to the people who feed the world. By providing the digital tools they need, we believe we can foster a more resilient, profitable, and sustainable agricultural sector for generations to come.
commitment.p2: Whether you're planting a seed, buying in bulk, or financing a farm, you have a place in the DamDoh community.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: This privacy notice for DamDoh describes how and why we might collect, store, use, and/or share ('process') your information when you use our services ('Services'), such as when you visit our website at http://damdoh.org, or any website of ours that links to this privacy notice; engage with us in other related ways, including any sales, marketing, or events.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: 1. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT?
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you register on the Services, express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products and Services, when you participate in activities on the Services, or otherwise when you contact us.

howWeUseInfo.heading: 2. HOW DO WE PROCESS YOUR INFORMATION?
howWeUseInfo.content: We process your information to provide, improve, and administer our Services, communicate with you, for security and fraud prevention, and to comply with law. We may also process your information for other purposes with your consent.

willInfoBeShared.heading: 3. WHEN AND WITH WHOM DO WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
willInfoBeShared.content: We may share information in specific situations and with specific third parties. Your information may be shared with our business partners, affiliates, and service providers to facilitate our Services.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: 4. DO WE USE COOKIES AND OTHER TRACKING TECHNOLOGIES?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies (like web beacons and pixels) to access or store information.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: 5. HOW LONG DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy notice unless otherwise required by law.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: 6. HOW DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION SAFE?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We have implemented appropriate and reasonable technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process.

minors.heading: 7. DO WE COLLECT INFORMATION FROM MINORS?
minors.content: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.

privacyRights.heading: 8. WHAT ARE YOUR PRIVACY RIGHTS?
privacyRights.content: You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time. Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information under applicable data protection laws.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: 9. CONTROLS FOR DO-NOT-TRACK FEATURES
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. We do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.

updatesToNotice.heading: 10. DO WE MAKE UPDATES TO THIS NOTICE?
updatesToNotice.content: Yes, we will update this notice as necessary to stay compliant with relevant laws.

contactUs.heading: 11. HOW CAN YOU CONTACT US ABOUT THIS NOTICE?
contactUs.content: If you have questions or comments about this notice, you may contact us by post at: DamDoh, 123 Agri-Tech Avenue, Nairobi, Kenya.

privacyPolicy.conclusion: You can do this via our {contactLink} page.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Fostering a professional, respectful, and trustworthy environment for everyone.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! Our mission is to connect the agricultural world in a positive and productive way. To ensure everyone has a great experience, we ask that you follow these guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Treat all members with courtesy. We do not tolerate harassment, hate speech, or personal attacks. Engage in constructive discussions, even when you disagree.

authentic.title: Be Authentic and Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business truthfully. Do not impersonate others or provide misleading information about your products, services, or credentials.

relevant.title: Stay On-Topic
relevant.description: Contribute to discussions with relevant insights. Avoid spam, excessive self-promotion, and off-topic content in professional forums and marketplace listings.

fairTrade.title: Honor Your Commitments
fairTrade.description: Conduct business transactions with integrity. Fulfill your orders, pay on time, and communicate clearly to build lasting, trust-based relationships.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainable Practices
sustainable.description: We encourage the sharing of knowledge and practices that support environmental, economic, and social sustainability in agriculture.

reporting.title: Report Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team. You can send details to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to these guidelines. We reserve the right to remove content and take action on accounts that violate these principles. Thank you for helping us build a positive community!

recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A potent growth enhancer made from the fermented sap of fast-growing plants.
ingredients: 1kg fast-growing plant parts (e.g., sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots)
steps: Collect plants before sunrise. Do not wash.
Mix with an equal weight of brown sugar.
Pack tightly in a breathable container, fill 2/3 full.
Cover with cloth, store in a cool, dark place for ~7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilute 1:500 to 1:1000 with water for foliar spray or soil drench.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A nitrogen-rich fertilizer made from fermented fish parts, great for vegetative growth.
steps: Layer fish and brown sugar in a container (2/3 full).
Cover and let ferment for 3-6 months in a cool, dark place.
recipeData.usage: Dilute 1:1000 with water, primarily for soil drenching.

recipeData.name: Water-Soluble Calcium (WCA)
recipeData.description: Provides essential calcium for fruiting and flowering stages.
steps: Roast eggshells until lightly browned, then crush into a powder.
Add eggshell powder to a jar.
Pour vinegar over powder (10 parts vinegar to 1 part eggshell by volume).
Bubbles will form. It's ready when bubbling stops (~7-10 days).
recipeData.usage: Dilute 1:1000 with water. Use as a foliar spray during flowering/fruiting.
